title: What Sappho Would Have Said: Four Centuries of Love Poems Between Women
description: An unpredictable gathering of 110 women poets of all sexualities, writing for friends or for lovers, all in some way speaking of love between women. The anthology stretches from America to Ireland, from Scotland to Italy, from Canada to New Zealand, from the 1660s to the 1990s.
author: Emma Donoghue
